content:
Why are empty lines treated differently from lines with left spaces?

For instance, in the last test:
   WHAT
I AM TOMMY
[empty line]

Becomes:
      TAHW(stripped of spaces on the right, not padded)
   YMMOT MA I
             (empty line padded to 13 spaces)

I would understand the logic if it was always padded or always stripped, but mixing the two seems completely arbitrary and makes it hard to figure out the general logic?

Could moderators please take into account the feedback before approving a puzzle?
@_martynas rightfully pointed out that several Validators are identical to their corresponding test case and yet, you approve without even waiting for the issue to be resolved?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: simple and precise

I think the empty line case (test and validator) will lead to a lot of confusion as it can be generated with many different possibilities (one space, n spaces...). I would recommande to avoid those cases.
Test cases and corresponding validators should differ to prevent hard coding. (Test 2 and Validator 2, Test 3 and Validator 3, Test 4 and Validator 4 are the same)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: it's clear and simple enough for clashes

I like it, it seems like a good fit for all three clash modes.
I'd go with the shortest goal text suggested by Tony.
Also, shouldn't the validators be different from the test cases?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice. 
I would remove the letters from the goal because there are no other letters in the inputs. We don't have to select anything so something like: "mirror the text with his alignment" would be fine.
This is especially annoying in Shortest mode
